thread.title: UEFA charges Dynamo Kiev for racist behavior by fans
thread.title_full: UEFA charges Dynamo Kiev for racist behavior by fans

title: UEFA charges Dynamo Kiev for racist behavior by fans
text:
UEFA charges Dynamo Kiev after racist attack by fans reported at Champions League match 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS October 22, 2015 - 5:02 am EDT 
NYON, Switzerland â€” UEFA says it charged Dynamo Kiev for racist behavior after black fans were reportedly attacked at a Champions League match. 
UEFA received reports from anti-discrimination group Fare that four men were attacked by other Dynamo fans in a home section of the Olympic Stadium at the 0-0 draw with Chelsea on Tuesday. Chelsea's Kurt Zouma, left, and Dynamo's Domagoj Vida struggle for the ball during the Champions League Group G soccer match between Dynamo Kiev and Chelsea FC in Kiev, Ukraine, Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015. (AP Photo/Sergei Chuzavkov) 
Before the match, UEFA promoted its "No To Racism" project which it runs with Fare. 
UEFA says its disciplinary committee will judge the case next Tuesday. 
Last season, UEFA sanctioned Dynamo for racist behavior by fans during a Europa League round-of-16 match against Everton.
